name: read
description: Read is used to read from file descriptors. This is an auxiliary syscall

name: write
description: Write is used to write to file descriptors. This is an auxiliary syscall

name: open
description: Open is used to open file descriptors. On Linux this opens the capability to open all kinds of descriptors including process descriptors(/proc), devices(/dev) and system object space (/sys)

name: close
description: Close is used to close an open file descriptor or socket.

name: stat
description: stat is used to read information about a file descriptor such as size, type and metadata.

name: fstat
description: fstat is used to read information about a file descriptor such as size, type and metadata.

name: lstat
description: lstat is used to read information about a file descriptor such as size, type and metadata.

name: poll
description: poll is used to determine whether a file descriptor is readable or writable.

name: lseek
description: lseek is used to seek the position of a file descriptor to an offset.

name: mmap
description: mmap is to map memory to the process's virtual address space. Some processes use this to efficiently read files.

name: mprotect
description: mprotect is used to change the protections on a memory page of a process. This is usually used for debug purposes.

name: munmap
description: munmap is used to unmap memory from the process's virtual address space.

name: brk
description: brk is used to set the program break for the calling process. The program break is the maximum size of memory the process can allocate.

name: rt_sigaction
description: rt_sigaction is used to set the signal handlers for the calling process.

name: rt_sigprocmask
description: rt_sigprocmask is used to change the signal mask for the calling process. The signal mask controls the behaviour when a signal is sent to the process.

name: rt_sigreturn
description: rt_sigreturn is called by the signal handler after a signal is dispatched and execution shall continue.

name: ioctl
description: ioctl is used to access special files like devices. Using ioctl you can call a device driver or a specific feature of the Linux kernel like seccomp

name: pread64
description: pread64 is a special version of read that reads at an offset to a buffer.

name: pwrite64
description: pwrite64 is a special version of write theat writes to an offset from a buffer.

name: readv
description: readv is used to read from a file descriptor using IoVecs. These structures are used to designate large areas of memory.

name: writev
description: writev is used to write to a file descriptor using IoVecs. These structures are used to designate large areas of memory.

name: access
description: access is used to test whether the calling process has access to the file. This can also be used with devices and kernel objects.

name: pipe
description: pipe is used to create a unidirectional channel for communication between processes.

name: select
description: select is used to monitor multiple file descriptors whether they are to read or write to.

name: sched_yield
description: sched_yield is used to give up the CPU for the calling thread. The next thread in queue gets executed.

name: mremap
description: mremap is used to expand, shrink or move an existing virtual memory mapping of the calling process.

name: msync
description: msync is used to sync the changes to a file that was mapped into memory with mmap back to the filesystem.

name: mincore
description: mincore is used to determine whether virtual memory is in physical RAM or on a page on disk.

name: madvise
description: madvise is used to optimize memory access by telling the kernel what it is used for to choose caching techniques.

name: shmget
description: shmget is used to get a SystemV shared memory segment or create a new one.

name: shmop
description: shmop is used to do operations on the shared memory segment. With this, a shared memory segment can be attached and detached to the process's virtual memory.

name: shmctl
description: shmctl is used to perform control operations on a shared memory segment. With this its size, permissions and more can be controlled.

name: dup
description: dup is used to create a duplicate of a file descriptor. This can be used to send file descriptors to child processes.

name: dup2
description: dup2 is used to create a duplicate of a file descriptor. This can be used to send file descriptors to child process.

name: pause
description: pause causes the calling process to sleep until a signal is delivered.

name: nanosleep
description: nanosleep is used to suspend the execution of the calling thread until the time has elapsed or a signal is delivered.

name: getitimer
description: getitimer is used to get access to a process-internal timer.

name: alarm
description: alarm sets a timer for x seconds to send a signal to the process.

name: setitimer
description: setitimer is used to arm or disarm a process-internal timer.

name: getpid
description: getpid returns the process ID of the calling process.

name: sendfile
description: sendfile copies data between one file descriptor and another.

name: socket
description: socket is used to open a socket to the internet or a unix socket. Make sure to check that the application really needs this syscall.

name: connect
description: connect connects the socket to the specified address.

name: accept
description: accept is used to accept an incoming connection on a socket and create a new socket for the data.

name: sendto
description: sendto is used to send a buffer over the socket to an address. This call is equivalent to write.

name: recv
description: recv is used to read data to a buffer from a socket from an address. This call is equivalent to read.

name: sendmsg
description: sendmsg is used to send data over a buffer to a socket. It also is able to send ancillary data including file descriptors over unix sockets. This is an auxiliary syscall.

name: recvmsg
description: recvmsg is used to receive data from a buffer over a socket. It also is able to send ancillary data including file descriptors over unix sockets.

name: shutdown
description: shutdown shuts down a connection of a socket without closing the socket.

name: bind
description: bind is used to bind a socket to an address. This is used to setup servers.

name: listen
description: listen is used to mark a socket as ready to accept connections.

name: getsockname
description: getsockname is used to get the current address of the socket.

name: getpeername
description: getpeername is used to get the address of the peer connected on the socket.

name: socketpair
description: socketpair is used to create 2 sockets that are connected to each other. This is frequently used for IPC between a child process and a parent.

name: setsockopt
description: setsockopt is used to set options on a socket.

name: getsockopt
description: getsockopt is used to get options of a socket.

name: clone
description: clone is used to create a new child process. Unlike fork, this is more fine-tuned.

name: fork
description: fork duplicates the current process.

name: vfork
description: vfork duplicates the current process without copying the heap.

name: execve
description: execve executes the program referred to by pathname.

name: exit
description: exit terminates the calling process.

name: wait4
description: wait4 waits on another process.

name: kill
description: kill sends a signal to another process. Make sure the application really needs this.

name: uname
description: uname returns information about the system like OS, version, hostname.

name: semget
description: semget is used to get or create a System V semaphore.

name: semop
description: semop is used to perform operations on semaphores.

name: semctl
description: semctl is used to perform control operations on semaphores

name: shmop
description: shmop is used to perform operations on shared memory segments.

name: msgget
description: msgget is used to get a System V message queue or create it.

name: msgsnd
description: msgsnd is used to send a message to the message queue.

name: msgrcv
description: msgrcv is used to the receive a message from the message queue.

name: msgctl
description: msgctl performs control operations on a message queue.

name: fcntl
description: fcntl is used to manipulate a file descriptor. For example, it can be used to set sockets as non-blocking.

name: flock
description: flock is used to apply or remove a lock on an open file.

name: fsync
description: fsync is used to synchronize a file to disk.

name: fdatasync
description: fdatasync is used to synchronize a file to disk without updating metadata unless necessary.

name: truncate
description: truncate is used to truncate a file to a specified length.

name: ftruncate
description: ftruncate is used to truncate a file to a specified length.

name: getdents
description: getdents is used to get the contents of a directory.

name: getcwd
description: getcwd is used to get the current working directory.

name: chdir
description: chdir is used to change the current working directory.

name: fchdir
description: fchdir is used to change the current working directory.

name: rename
description: rename is used to rename a file or directory.

name: mkdir
description: mkdir is used to create a directory.

name: rmdir
description: rmdir is used to delete an empty directory.

name: creat
description: creat is used to create a file and create it.

name: link
description: link is used to create a hard link for a file.

name: unlink
description: unlink is used to delete a hard link or remove a socket.

name: symlink
description: symlink is used to create a symbolic link at the path.

name: readlink
description: readlink is used to resolve a symbolic link at runtime.

name: chmod
description: chmod is used to change the permissions of a file. Make sure the application really needs to use this.

name: fchmod
description: fchmod is used to change the permissions of a file. Make sure the application really needs to use this.

name: chown
description: chown is used to change the ownership of a file. Make sure the application really needs to use this.

name: fchown
description: fchown is used to change the ownership of a file. Make sure the application really needs to use this.

name: lchown
description: lchown is used to change the ownership of a file. Make sure the application really needs to use this.

name: umask
description: umask is used to set the file mode creation mask. This changes the permissions a file is set to on default when the process creates a new one.

name: gettimeofday
description: gettimeofday is used to get the current time of day.

name: getrlimit
description: getrlimit is used to get the calling process's resource limits.

name: getrusage
description: getrusage is used to get the calling process's resource usages.

name: sysinfo
description: sysinfo is used to get certain statistics on memory and swap usage.

name: times
description: times is used to get the prcoess times.

name: ptrace
description: ptrace is used to control the execution of another process. Debugger's use this to control a processes behaviour. ptrace should never be used by a normal application.

name: getuid
description: getuid returns the actual user id of the calling process.

name: syslog
description: syslog is used to access the kernel printk() buffer; this buffer is used by the kernel and kernel modules to print messages.

name: getgid
description: getgid returns the real group id of the calling process.

name: setuid
description: setuid sets the effective user id of the calling process. With this it is able to drop root privileges to unprivileged.

name: setgid
description: setgid sets the effective group id of the calling process.

name: geteuid
description: getuid returns the effective user id of the calling process.

name: getegid
description: getgid returns the effective group id of the calling process.

name: setpgid
description: setpgid is used to set the process group id. Bash uses this to control background processes.

name: getppid
description: getppid returns the parent's process id.

name: getpgid
description: getpgid returns the process group id of the calling process.

name: setsid
description: setsid is used to create a new session and process group for the calling process.

name: setreuid
description: setreuid is used to set the effective and real user id of the calling process.

name: setregid
description: setregid is used to set the effective and real group id of the calling process.

name: getgroups
description: getgroups returns a list of all groups the process has assigned.

name: setgroups
description: setgroups is used to set the list of all groups the process has assigned.

name: setresuid
description: setresuid is used to to set the actual, effective and saved user id.

name: geresuid
description: getresuid returns the actual, effective and saved user id.

name: setresgid
description: setresgid is used to to set the actual, effective and saved group id.

name: getresgid
description: getresgid returns the actual, effective and saved user id.

name: getpgid
description: getpgid returns the process group id of the calling process.

name: setfsuid
description: setfsuid sets the effective user id used for checking file system operations. This syscall is deprecated.

name: setfsgid
description: setfsuid sets the effective group id used for checking file system operations. This syscall is deprecated.

name: getsid
description: getsid returns the session id of the calling process.

name: capget
description: capget returns a list of the capabilities of the calling thread.

name: capset
description: capset is used to set capabilities for the calling thread. For example, CAP_SYS_ADMIN grants wide-administrator privileges.

name: rt_sigpending
description: rt_sigpending is a runtime function used to check whether a signal is pending on the calling process.

name: rt_sigtimedwait
description: rt_sigtimedwait is a runtime function used to wait for queued signals.

name: rt_sigqueueinfo
description: rt_sigqueueinfo is a runtime function used to send a signal plus data to a process or thread.

name: rt_sigsuspend
description: rt_sigsuspend is a runtime function used to change the signal mask and wait for a signal.

name: sigaltstack
description: sigaltstack is used to define an alternative stack for signal handlers in case a SIGSEGV happens.

name: utime
description: utime sets the last access and modification times for a file.

name: mknod
description: mknod is used to create an ordinary or special file.

name: uselib
description: uselib is used to load a shared library. This syscall is deprecated.

name: personality
description: personality is used to set the process execution domain. This enables older apps to work.

name: ustat
description: ustat is used to get information about a mounted filesystem. This syscall is deprecated.

name: statfs
description: statfs is used to get information about a mounted filesystem.

name: fstatfs
description: fstatfs is used to get information about a mounted filesystem.

name: sysfs
description: sysfs is used to get information about a filesystem type. This syscall is deprecated.

name: getpriority
description: getpriority is used to get the process priority.

name: setpriority
description: Sets the scheduling priority of a process, process group, or user.

name: sched_setparam
description: Sets the scheduling parameters for the specified process.

name: sched_getparam
description: Retrieves the scheduling parameters for the specified process.

name: sched_setscheduler
description: Sets the scheduling policy and parameters for the specified process.

name: sched_getscheduler
description: Retrieves the scheduling policy currently applied to the specified process.

name: sched_get_priority_max
description: Returns the maximum scheduling priority value for the specified policy.

name: sched_get_priority_min
description: Returns the minimum scheduling priority value for the specified policy.

name: sched_rr_get_interval
description: Retrieves the time quantum for the round-robin scheduling policy for the specified process.

name: mlock
description: Locks part of the calling process's virtual address space into RAM, preventing that memory from being paged to the swap area.

name: munlock
description: Unlocks previously locked memory, allowing it to be paged out to the swap area if necessary.

name: mlockall
description: Locks all pages mapped into the address space of the calling process.

name: munlockall
description: Unlocks all pages mapped into the address space of the calling process.

name: vhangup
description: Hangs up the current terminal session, ensuring all programs using the terminal are properly reset.

name: modify_ldt
description: Modifies the local descriptor table (LDT) for the calling process.

name: pivot_root
description: Changes the root filesystem of the current process to a new directory and moves the old root to a subdirectory of the new root.

name: _sysctl
description: Obsolete syscall used to query or set system-level parameters and information.

name: prctl
description: Allows calling processes to control specific characteristics of its behavior.

name: arch_prctl
description: Sets architecture-specific thread state.

name: adjtimex
description: Adjusts the kernel's timekeeping variables.

name: setrlimit
description: Sets resource limits for the calling process, such as CPU time or maximum file size.

name: chroot
description: Changes the root directory of the calling process to the specified path.

name: sync
description: Forces completion of pending disk writes (synchronously).

name: acct
description: Enables or disables process accounting.

name: settimeofday
description: Sets the system clock (time and date).

name: mount
description: Mounts a filesystem, making it accessible at a specified directory.

name: umount2
description: Unmounts a mounted filesystem.

name: swapon
description: Enables a device or file for paging and swapping.

name: swapoff
description: Disables paging and swapping on the specified device or file.

name: reboot
description: Restarts the system.

name: sethostname
description: Sets the system hostname.

name: setdomainname
description: Sets the NIS domain name of the host.

name: iopl
description: Changes the I/O privilege level of the calling process.

name: ioperm
description: Sets the I/O port access permissions for the calling process.

name: create_module
description: Obsolete, was used to create a loadable kernel module.

name: init_module
description: Loads a loadable kernel module into the kernel.

name: delete_module
description: Removes a loadable kernel module from the kernel.

name: get_kernel_syms
description: Obsolete, was used to get symbols from the kernel.

name: query_module
description: Obsolete, was used to query information about kernel modules.

name: quotactl
description: Manipulates disk quotas.

name: nfsservctl
description: Obsolete, was used to control NFS server services.

name: getpmsg
description: Obsolete, not implemented in standard Linux kernel versions.

name: putpmsg
description: Obsolete, not implemented in standard Linux kernel versions.

name: afs_syscall
description: Obsolete, placeholder for an AFS filesystem syscall.

name: tuxcall
description: Obsolete, placeholder for tuxedo subsystem call, not implemented.

name: security
description: Obsolete, placeholder for security model syscall, not implemented.

name: gettid
description: Returns the caller's thread ID.

name: readahead
description: Reads data from a file into the page cache before it is needed.

name: setxattr
description: Sets an extended attribute value for a file.

name: lsetxattr
description: Sets an extended attribute value for a link.

name: fsetxattr
description: Sets an extended attribute value for an open file descriptor.

name: getxattr
description: Retrieves an extended attribute value for a file.

name: lgetxattr
description: Retrieves an extended attribute value for a link.

name: fgetxattr
description: Retrieves an extended attribute value for an open file descriptor.

name: listxattr
description: Lists the extended attribute names for a file.

name: llistxattr
description: Lists the extended attribute names for a link.

name: flistxattr
description: Lists the extended attribute names for an open file descriptor.

name: removexattr
description: Removes an extended attribute from a file.

name: lremovexattr
description: Removes an extended attribute from a link.

name: fremovexattr
description: Removes an extended attribute from an open file descriptor.

name: tkill
description: Sends a signal to a thread within the same process as the caller.
